rComments: Good guy, helpful, works with people that fall behind.  He's understanding and if you pay attention you can grasp the material.

He teaches tough material, so he is not well liked. However, he tries quite hard to help his students succeed. He provided extensive resources on the class website to assist students with their assignments. There is no midterm and no final exam, but assignments are very difficult.
hate this class. hate this prof. absolutely terrible at teaching. without some of the TAs this class would fall apart. he is awful!! (and my grade as of now is a B)
very inconsiderate rude

Has a uncontrolled temperament, while meeting in personal time. I had great interest in the course, however his lack of teaching ability and mild frustration while teaching, deterred my motivation to understand statistics of social science.
the content of the course was easy. I thought it was going to involve complex mathematical calculations, but it was more method-based. solid prof.

Fletcher is wonderful as a professor. He genuinely tries to make statistics easier for those who are struggling, has his TAs students disposal 24/7, and oft bumps up grades in recog of effort. I had no math/computer background and got an A-. My impression is that some students get this class and others don't.

Often confusing. Teaches material in a non-sequential way, subjects jump all over. If it weren't for the political orientation of this class it would probably get axed for a better and more thorough statistics course. Why does stats have to be politically oriented in order to teach it to poli sci students?

I transferred out of commerce into politics and this is the only course that makes me think that my decision was worthwhile. POL242 initially seemed daunting, but it turned out to be the most engaging and ?job applicable? political science course I have ever taken.  The Prof is very accommodating and his TAs are very dedicated to helping students s

terrible. worst class I've ever taken and he didn't help any. If it weren't because of requirements, I would have dropped. He is terrible, I'd rather lick a computer monitor. Monotone, boring, and often rude.
I didn't enjoy the style of teaching.
Unclear, inarticulate, and ineffective, yet extremely arrogant.  Insincere and underhanded - will try to ruin your future career plans if he feels threatened by your abilities.

I have a strong computer science and calculus background, so working with numbers is not a big challenge for me. Professor is very clear and very helpful. the course is very challenging. You got to spend an average of 10 hours on each assignment if you want to get an A in the course. Plus you should be talented ;-) I find the course very interestng
very kind and very caring - knows his stuff!

Honestly, I have no idea what people are talking about...Fletcher is amazing...He is an amazing prof. He always asks how he can make the class better for us and he is genuinely happy when he sees that his students are making progress...Don't pay attention to the bad reviews...he is very very very good

Class was very useful. Learned a lot. Fletcher seems nice until you get to the exam. He laughed when a girl cried because the damn exam was SOOOOOOO sneaky/underhanded/compared to genocide/enough to send me to a shrink. Fletcher is very upfront about his lack of popularity with dumb students...TRUST ME: SMART STUDENTS WERE DYING TOO. TAKE IN SUMMER

wow. worst prof i've ever had. never seen so many students leave a test crying! literally bawling. and his lectures make me a course in paint drying look preferable.  but in all fairness, his online tutorials are very useful. but for all i know the TAs made those.

First half of this course was great. But Fletcher places waaaay too much emphasis on 'social science', research methods, AND HIS OWN WORK (which is quite frankly not very impressive). He also does a horrible job communicating course requirements. I would never take another course with him again.

Prof. Fletcher = ?????????????????  forget the students having an idea about course expectations. He doesn't know what he expects out of the course. Makes you write reflection papers which are randomly graded. Interesting course but the prof ruined it by not communicating course requirements clearly.
Lost...and I am not talking about the TV show.
No Comments
I dunno about these other comments - the course is very accessible if you simply read the website. I found Prof. fletcher easy to understand and helpful.

He teaches Stats so everyone hates him, but I had him for the course "Politics and Psychology". He was interesting, very very funny, entertaining and really passionate about the subject, which made everyone else in the class really excited to learn about it. A great experience!
What a jerk! TAKE THE CLASS IN THE SUMMER, MUCH EASIER!  THE TA'S ACTUALLY HAVE TIME TO HELP YOU!

Arrogant and unhelpful.  Poor teacher and lecturer.   Ineptly explains concepts.  Disinterested in student satisfaction and student success.  Much more interested in himself and his perceived accomplishments, which are little to speak of.
Forced people to change career paths

He thinks way too highly of the "power" of research methods to change one's life. Not very explicit about what it takes to get a good mark on any given assignment. You must pay full attention to course work or you might as well drop it early.
Thinks way too highly of his course and himself.
No Comments

Unbelievable what some people think they can get away with given a degree from the University of Alberta. Granted the material did not lend itself to insightful presentation but I have never before met anyone who claims more authority on a topic while lacking any and all substantive merit.
more the material than anything else, but also a real harsh marker
Pol 313Y1 (Politics and Psychology) was the best course I have taken in University. Pol 242 (Research Methods) was horrible. In Pol 242, Fletcher did a good job with incredibly boring material.
Enthusiastic and effective lecturer given the topic  but lacking content related to assignments and online tutorials. Likewise, textbooks are easy-to-read, but somewhat unhelpful towards assignments.
